decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans and on the submitted application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development shall be completed in accordance with the following details which shall have been submitted to and approved in writing with the Local Planning Authority, prior to above ground works(a) manufacturer (s) details to show the wood effect UPVC window frames, door and bi folding doors ( including their dimensions, colour and texture)Reason : In order that the architectural and historic interest of the Old Malden Conservation Area (A) Conservation Area is safeguarded in accordance with Policy CS8 (Character, Heritage and Design) and Policy DM12 (development in Conservation Areas and Affecting Heritage Assets) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted 2012

The works shall be carried out and maintained in accordance with the deposited Fire Statement compliant with Policy D12(A).Reason: In the interests of fire safety and to ensure the safety of all building users in accordance with Policy D12 (Fire Safety) of the London Plan 2021.
description: Replacement of majority of the house (including the full front elevation, upstairs upper windows and kitchen door) from wooden frame cottage style windows to like-for-like cottage style uPVC windows in white, wood effect. Replacement of back doors and one small window with a larger opening and 3 bifold doors, in like for like style (aluminium frames)
